page.title: 05NORTHFIELD WOOD
page.content: Northfield Wood lies immediately to the north of the small village of Onehouse.Soils are strong loams derived from glacial clays over-laying Norwich Crag.Rainfall averages 24 inches per annum. Apart from 2.0 hectares of 100 year old oak,ash and beech, and 2.0 hectares of 35 year old oak and hornbeam, the rest of the woodland has been replanted since 1961,with coniferous species, mainly Norway spruce with some Western Red cedar and Scots pine and an expected rotation of between 50 and 60 years.These plantations are well stocked and will shortly be requiring their first thinning. Deer,rabbits and foxes, thrive in the wood and can cause problems for local farmers.
